Being too dependent on our GPS (Global Positioning System) is one sign that we have become too dependent on technology. Sure it does help us get from point A to point B without a hitch and help avoid traffic jams or road construction. But relying too much on the GPS stops us from navigating for ourselves whenever we are in unfamiliar territory as we often rely on the GPS to navigate unfamiliar territory. Sometimes, you will have to rely on your bearings as the GPS isn’t always reliable. Knowing what your bearings are can often help you get to your destination quicker and safely without the GPS, and teaches us how to navigate for ourselves. There have been numerous stories of people driving their cars into a lake or people traveling in the wrong direction from where they are actually headed. With that, you can end up in a life or death situation. It’s a sign that we have become too dependent on technology and that we don’t really give it a second thought when we use the GPS to get from point A to point B. It’s good to have a sense of direction by reading a map and a compass to find our bearings than just blindly relying on the GPS. Knowing how to navigate for yourself and knowing how to read a printed map and road signs and knowing what your bearings are will always be useful and probably save your life if you feel that you could be headed in the wrong direction.
